intro: Salpichroa mandoniana, commonly known as the Mandon's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. It produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually simple and alternate. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
